com.illcode.hl7

Class Message

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.illcode.hl7.Message

  • public final class Message
extends java.lang.Object
    An HL7v2 message. A message is represent as a map from a segment ID to a list of SegmentS (with entries in the list being the repetitions of segments in the message).

      Construct an empty message.

      • containsSegment

        public boolean containsSegment(java.lang.String id)

      • segments

        public java.util.Collection<java.util.List<Segment>> segments()
        Return a collection of all the repetitions of segments in the message.

        Note that the iteration order of the returned collection is the order in which the segment lists were added to the message, so to get a well-formed HL7 message, you'll either need to:

        1. Insert segments in the correct order (i.e. MSH first, etc.), or
        2. Pick out the segments you need in the appropriate order using getSegment(String) or getSegment(String, int) and encode them individually

      • getSegments

        public java.util.List<Segment> getSegments(java.lang.String id)
        Return a list of repetitions for a given segment ID, or null if no segment with that ID is in the message.

      • getSegment

        public Segment getSegment(java.lang.String id,
                 int repetition)
        Return a given reptition of segments with the given ID, or null if no such segment is in the Message.

      • getSegment

        public Segment getSegment(java.lang.String id)
        Return the first segment (among any repetitions) with the given ID, or null if no such segment is in the Message.

      • putSegment

        public void putSegment(Segment s)
        Put a segment into the message. If a segment with the same ID already exists, the new segment is added as a repetition.

      • removeSegment

        public void removeSegment(Segment s)
        Remove a segment from the message.

      • getMessageType

        public java.lang.String getMessageType()
        Returns the message type found in MSH.9, if present, or null otherwise.

        Example: "QRY^A19"

      • getField

        public java.lang.String getField(java.lang.String spec)
        Returns the string value of a segment field given a path-like spec string as input. The forms that this spec string may take are described below. SID is the three-character segment ID, and F, R, C, and S are positive integers.
        1. SID.F — field F of segment SID
        2. SID.F.C — component C of field F of segment SID
        3. SID.F.C.S — subcomponent S of component C of field F of segment SID
        Each of these forms has a variant where the field number F is given in the format "F(R)", where R is the repetition number (starting at 1) for a given field.

        Examples:

        "MSH.9.1" - Message Type
        "PID.3(2).1 - The ID portion (i.e. PID.3.1) of the 2nd repetition in the PID.3 field.
        Likewise, for segments that can repeat in a message, the SID can be written SID(R) to get the Rth repetition. Ex: "NK1(2).2.1" for the Family Name of the second instance of the NK1 segment.

        If the repetition number is not specified for segment IDs or fields, it defaults to 1.

        HAPI Terser Compatibility Syntax

        To be partially compatible with the syntax for HAPI's Terser class, you can use a dash "-" in place of the periods "." in the above format. Also, if the spec string starts with a slash "/", it will be silently discarded.

        Parameters:
        spec - spec string, as above
        Returns:
        the field value or the empty string "" if such a field is not present in the message

      • setField

        public void setField(java.lang.String spec,
            java.lang.String value)
        Sets a field of a segment in the message.
        Parameters:
        spec - spec string as described in the docs for getField(java.lang.String)
        value - scalar value to assign to the field
